question_text: How many people are living or staying at this address? Include everyone who usually lives or stays at this address. Do NOT include anyone who is living somewhere else for more than two months, such as a college student living away or someone in the Armed Forces on deployment
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: How many of these people in your household are family members? Family is defined as anyone related to this child by blood, marriage, adoption, or through foster care
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: Income in 2023 Mark (X) the "Yes" box for EACH type of income this child’s family received, and give your best estimate of the TOTAL AMOUNT IN THE LAST CALENDAR YEAR. Mark (X) the "No" box to show types of income NOT received. a. Wages, salary, commissions, or bonuses b. Self-employment income from own nonfarm businesses or farm business, including proprietorships and partnerships c. Interest, dividends, net rental income, royalty income, or income from estates and trusts. d. Social Secutiry or Railroad Retirement; retirement, survivor, or disability pensions. e. Supplemental Security Income (SSI); any public assistance or welfare payments from the state or local welfare office. f. Any other sources of income received regularly such as Veterans' (VA) payments, unemployment compensation, child support, or alimony.
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: The following question is about your 2023 income. Think about your total combined family income IN THE LAST CALENDAR YEAR for all members of the family. What is that amount before taxes? Include money from jobs, child support, social security, retirement income, unemployment payments, public assistance, and so forth. Also, include income from interest, dividends, net income from businesses, farm or rent, and any other money income received.
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: In general, how would you describe this child’s health (the one named above)?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: How would you describe the condition of this child’s teeth?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: A4 DURING THE PAST 12 MONTHS, has this child had FREQUENT or CHRONIC difficulty with any of the following? a. Breathing or other respiratory problems (such as wheezing or shortness of breath) b. Eating or swallowing because of a health condition c. Digesting food, including stomach/intestinal problems, constipation, or diarrhea d. Repeated or chronic physical pain, including headaches or other back or body pain e. Toothaces f. Bleeding gums g. Decayed teeth or cavities
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: Does the child have any of the following? a. Serious difficulty concentrating, remembering, or making decisions because of a physical, mental, or emotional condition b. Serious difficulty walking or climbing stairs e. Deafness or problems with hearing f. Blindness or problems with seeing, even when wearing glasses c. Difficulty dressing or bathing d. Difficulty doing errands alone, such as visiting a doctor’s office or shopping, because of a physical, mental, or emotional condition
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: Has a doctor or other health care provider EVER told you that this child has... Allergies (such as food, drug, insect, seasonal, or other)? If yes, does this child CURRENTLY have the condition? Asthma? If yes, does this child CURRENTLY have the condition? Autoimmune disease (such as Type 1 Diabetes, Celiac, or Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis)? Cerebral Palsy? Type 2 Diabetes? Epilepsy or Seizure Disorder? Heart Condition? Frequent or severe headaches, including migraines? Tourette Syndrome? Anxiety Problems? Depression? Down Syndrome? Blood Disorders (such as Sickle Cell Disease, Thalassemia, or Hemophilia)? Cystic Fibrosis? Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorder (FASD)?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: Has a doctor, other health care provider, or educator EVER told you that this child has... Examples of educators are teachers and school nurses. Behavioral or Conduct Problems? Developmental Delay? Intellectual Disability (formerly known as Mental Retardation)? Speech or other language disorder? Learnng disability?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: Has a doctor or other health care provider EVER told you that this child has Autism or Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD)? Include diagnoses of Asperger’s Disorder or Pervasive Developmental Disorder (PDD).
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: How old was this child when a doctor or other health care provider FIRST told you that they had Autism, ASD, Asperger’s Disorder or PDD?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: What type of doctor or other health care provider was the FIRST to tell you that this child had Autism, ASD, Asperger’s Disorder or PDD?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: Is this child CURRENTLY taking medication for Autism, ASD, Asperger’s Disorder or PDD?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: At any time DURING THE PAST 12 MONTHS, did this child receive behavioral treatment for Autism, ASD, Asperger’s Disorder or PDD, such as training or an intervention that you or this child received to help with their behavior?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: Has a doctor or other health care provider EVER told you that this child has Attention Deficit Disorder or Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder, that is, ADD or ADHD?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: Is this child CURRENTLY taking medication for ADD or ADHD?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: At any time DURING THE PAST 12 MONTHS, did this child receive behavioral treatment for ADD or ADHD, such as training or an intervention that you or this child received to help with their behavior?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: Do you think this child has EVER had a concussion or brain injury? A concussion or brain injury is when a blow or jolt to the head causes problems such as headaches, dizziness, being dazed or confused, difficulty remembering or concentrating, vomiting, blurred vision, changes in mood or behavior, or being knocked out. If yes, did you seek medical care from a doctor or other health care provider? If yes, did a doctor or other health care provider tell you that your child has a concussion or brain injury?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: DURING THE PAST 12 MONTHS, how often have this child’s health conditions or problems affected their ability to do things other children their age do?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: To what extent do this child’s health conditions or problems affect their ability to do things?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: Was this child born more than 3 weeks before their due date?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: What month and year was this child born?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: How much did they weigh when born? Answer in pounds and ounces OR kilograms and grams. Your best estimate is fine.
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: DURING THE PAST 12 MONTHS, did this child see a doctor, nurse, or other health care professional for sick-child care, well-child check-ups, physical exams, hospitalizations or any other kind of medical care? Include health care visits done by video or phone.
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: If yes, at their LAST medical care visit, did this child have a chance to speak with a doctor or other health care provider privately, without you or another caregiver in the room?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: If yes, DURING THE PAST 12 MONTHS, how many times did this child visit a doctor, nurse, or other health care professional to receive a PREVENTIVE check-up? A preventive check-up is when this child was not sick or injured, such as an annual or sports physical, or well-child visit.
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: Thinking about the LAST TIME you took this child for a PREVENTIVE check-up, about how long was the doctor or health care provider who examined this child in the room with you? Your best estimate is fine
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: What is this child’s CURRENT height? Your best estimate is fine
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: How much does this child CURRENTLY weigh? Your best estimate is fine
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: Are you concerned about this child’s weight?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: Has a doctor or other health care provider ever told you that this child is overweight?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: DURING THE PAST 12 MONTHS, did this child engage in any of the following? a. Skipping meals or fasting (Do NOT include skipping meals or fasting for religious reasons) b. Having low interest in food c. Extremely picky eating d. Binge eating e. Purging or vomiting after eating f. Using diet pills, laxatives, or diuretics (water pills) to lose or maintain weight without a doctor's orders g. Over-exercising h. Not eating due to fear of vomiting or choking
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: DURING THE PAST 12 MONTHS, how concerned were you about this child engaging in these behaviors?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: DURING THE PAST 12 MONTHS, how concerned was this child about their weight, body shape, or body size?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: Is there a place you or another caregiver USUALLY take this child when they are sick or you need advice about their health?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: If yes, where does this child USUALLY go first?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: Is there a place that this child USUALLY goes when they need routine preventive care, such as a physical examination or well-child check-up?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: If yes, is this the same place this child goes when they are sick?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: DURING THE PAST 2 YEARS, has this child received a vision screening from a care provider other than an eye doctor? The screening could have occurred at a pediatrician’s office, in a school, preschool/child care center, or a community setting, using pictures, shapes, letters, or a camera like tool.
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: If yes, was it recommended that this child see an eye doctor or other eye care provider for an eye examination or additional vision services as a result of the vision screening? An eye doctor may be referred to as an optometrist or ophthalmologist.
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: DURING THE PAST 2 YEARS, has this child seen an eye doctor? An eye doctor may be referred to as an optometrist or ophthalmologist. If yes, what care has this child received from the eye doctor?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: DURING THE PAST 12 MONTHS, did this child see a dentist or other oral health care provider for any kind of dental or oral health care?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: If yes, DURING THE PAST 12 MONTHS, did this child see a dentist or other oral health care provider for PREVENTIVE dental care, such as check-ups, dental cleanings, dental sealants, or fluoride treatments?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: If yes, DURING THE PAST 12 MONTHS, what PREVENTIVE dental service(s) did this child receive?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: DURING THE PAST 12 MONTHS, has this child received any treatment or counseling from a mental health professional? Mental health professionals include psychiatrists, psychologists, psychiatric nurses, and clinical social workers
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: How difficult was it to get the mental health treatment or counseling that this child needed?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: DURING THE PAST 12 MONTHS, has this child taken any medication because of difficulties with their emotions, concentration, or behavior?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: DURING THE PAST 12 MONTHS, did this child see a specialist other than a mental health professional? Specialists are doctors like surgeons, heart doctors, allergy doctors, skin doctors, and others who specialize in one area of health care
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: How difficult was it to get the specialist care that this child needed?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: DURING THE PAST 12 MONTHS, was there any time when this child needed health care but it was not received? By health care, we mean medical care as well as other kinds of care like dental care, vision care, and mental health services. If yes, which types of care were not received?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: Did any of the following reasons contribute to this child not receiving needed health services?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: DURING THE PAST 12 MONTHS, how often were you frustrated in your efforts to get services for this child?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: DURING THE PAST 12 MONTHS, how many times did this child visit a hospital emergency room? Do NOT include visits to urgent care centers
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: DURING THE PAST 12 MONTHS, was this child admitted to the hospital to stay for at least one night?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: Has this child EVER had a special education or early intervention plan? Children receiving these services often have an Individualized Family Service Plan (IFSP) or Individualized Education Plan (IEP). If yes, how old was this child at the time of the FIRST plan?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: Is this child CURRENTLY receiving services under one of these plans?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: Has this child EVER received special services to meet their developmental needs? Special services can include therapies such as speech, occupational, physical or behavioral or other services received to meet developmental needs.
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: If yes, how old was this child when they began receiving these special services?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: Is this child CURRENTLY receiving these special services?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: Has a doctor, other health care provider, or educator EVER recommended that this child be evaluated for a Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorder? Examples of educators are teachers and school nurses
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: Has this child EVER received an evaluation for a Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorder?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: Do you have one or more persons you think of as this child’s personal doctor or nurse? A personal doctor or nurse is a health professional who knows this child well and is familiar with this child’s health history. This can be a general doctor, a pediatrician, a specialist doctor, a nurse practitioner, or a physician assistant.
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: DURING THE PAST 12 MONTHS, did this child need a referral to see any doctors or receive any services?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: How difficult was it to get referrals?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: DURING THE PAST 12 MONTHS, how often did this child’s doctors or other health care providers...
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: DURING THE PAST 12 MONTHS, how often did this child's doctors or other health care providers... a. Spend enough time with this child? b. Listen carefully to you? c. Show sensitivity to your family’s values and customs? d. Provide the specific information you needed concerning this child? e. Help you feel like a partner in this child's care?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: DURING THE PAST 12 MONTHS, did you, another caregiver, or a health care provider need to make any decisions regarding this child’s health care, such as whether to get prescriptions, referrals, or procedures?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: If yes, DURING THE PAST 12 MONTHS, how often did this child's doctors or other health care providers... a. Discuss with you the range of options to consider for their health care or treatment? b. Make it easy for you to raise concerns or disagree with recommendations for this child’s health care? c. Work with you to decide together which health care and treatment choices would be best for this child?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: DURING THE PAST 12 MONTHS, did anyone help you arrange or coordinate this child’s care among the different doctors or services that this child uses?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: DURING THE PAST 12 MONTHS, have you felt that you could have used extra help arranging or coordinating this child’s care among the different health care providers or services?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: If yes, DURING THE PAST 12 MONTHS, how often did you get as much help as you wanted with arranging or coordinating this child’s health care?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: DURING THE PAST 12 MONTHS, how satisfied were you with the communication between this child’s doctors and other health care providers?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: DURING THE PAST 12 MONTHS, did this child’s health care provider communicate with the child’s school, child care provider, or special education program?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: If yes, during this time, how satisfied were you with the health care provider’s communication with the school, child care provider, or special education program?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: Do any of this child’s doctors or other health care providers treat only children?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: If yes, have they talked with you about when this child will need to see doctors or other health care providers who treat adults?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: Has the child's doctor or other health care provider actively worked with this child to: a. Make positive choices about their health. For example, by eating healthy, getting regular exercise, not using tobacco, alchohol or other drugs, or delabying sexual activity?b. Gain skills to manage their health and health care. For example, by understanding current health needs, knowing what to do in a medical emergency, or taking medications they may need? c. Understand the changes in health care that happen at age 18. For example, by understanding changes in privacy, consent, access to information, or decision-making?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: Did you and this child receive a summary of your child’s medical history (for example, medical conditions, allergies, medications, immunizations)?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: Have this child’s doctors or other health care providers worked with you and this child to create a plan of care to meet their health goals and needs? If yes, do you and this child have access to this plan of care?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: Does this plan of care address transition to doctors and other health care providers who treat adults?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: Eligibility for health insurance often changes in young adulthood. Do you know how this child will be insured as they become an adult?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: If no, has anyone discussed with you how to obtain or keep some type of health insurance coverage as this child becomes an adult?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: DURING THE PAST 12 MONTHS, was this child EVER covered by ANY kind of health insurance or health coverage plan?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: Is this child CURRENTLY covered by ANY kind of health insurance or health coverage plan?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: Is this child CURRENTLY covered by any of the following types of health insurance or health coverage plans?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: How often does this child’s health insurance offer benefits or cover services that meet this child’s needs?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: How often does this child’s health insurance allow them to see the health care providers they need?
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: Including co-pays and amounts reimbursed from Health Savings Accounts (HSA) and Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA), how much money did you pay for this child’s medical, health, dental, and vision care DURING THE PAST 12 MONTHS? Do not include health insurance premiums or costs that were or will be reimbursed by insurance or another source.
survey_key: National Survey of Children's Health Topical Questionaire (Children, 12-17)

question_text: How often are these costs reasonable?

question_text: e National Practitioner Data Bank (NPDB), is a nationwide repository of negative actions taken against health care professionals. Its primary function is to aid employers in making well-informed hiring decisions. Currently, certain entities are required to query the NPDB on physicians and dentists, prior to making decisions on hiring and clinical privileges. Do you think the query requirement should be expanded to other health care professions?
survey_key: National Sample Survey of Registered Nurses (NSSRN)

question_text: Have you been reported to the NPDB?
survey_key: National Sample Survey of Registered Nurses (NSSRN)

question_text: Who submitted the report(s)?
survey_key: National Sample Survey of Registered Nurses (NSSRN)

question_text: Did the NPDB report impact your career?
survey_key: National Sample Survey of Registered Nurses (NSSRN)

question_text: When making hiring decisions, do you feel that health care employers should consider prior negative health care related actions taken against prospective employees?
survey_key: National Sample Survey of Registered Nurses (NSSRN)

question_text: e NPDB collects reports on adverse actions taken against a physician that affect that physician’s clinical privileges. Many Nurse Practitioners currently perform job functions similar to physicians. Do you feel the NPDB should also collect reports on adverse actions against a Nurse Practitioner that could affect their clinical privileges?
survey_key: National Sample Survey of Registered Nurses (NSSRN)

question_text: Do you think Nurse Practitioners who are supervised by a physician should be subject to the same reporting requirements as physicians, less strict reporting requirements, or more strict reporting requirements?
survey_key: National Sample Survey of Registered Nurses (NSSRN)

survey_key: National Sample Survey of Registered Nurses (NSSRN)

question_text: To what extent do you agree or disagree with each of the following statements? The school administration’s behavior toward the staff is supportive and encouraging. b. I am satisfied with my teaching salary. c. The level of student misbehavior in this school (such as noise, horseplay or fighting in the halls, cafeteria, or student lounge) interferes with my teaching. d. I receive a great deal of support from parents for the work I do. e. Necessary materials such as textbooks, supplies, and copy machines are available as needed by the staff. f. Routine duties and paperwork interfere with my job of teaching. My principal enforces school rules for student conduct and backs me up when I need it. g. Rules for student behavior are consistently enforced by teachers in this school, even for students who are not in their classes. h. Most of my colleagues share my beliefs and values about what the central mission of the school should be. i. The principal knows what kind of school he or she wants and has communicated it to the staff. j. There is a great deal of cooperative effort among the staff members. k. In this school, staff members are recognized for a job well done. l. I worry about the security of my job because of the performance of my students or my school on state and/or local tests. m. State or district content standards have had a positive influence on my satisfaction with teaching. n. I am given the support I need to teach students with special needs. o. Strongly disagree Somewhat disagree Somewhat agree Strongly agree The amount of student tardiness and class cutting in this school interferes with my teaching. p. I am generally satisfied with being a teacher at this school. q. I make a conscious effort to coordinate the content of my courses with that of other teachers

question_text: To what extent do you agree or disagree with each of the following statements? a. The school administration’s behavior toward the staff is supportive and encouraging. b. I am satisfied with my teaching salary. c. The level of student misbehavior in this school (such as noise, horseplay or fighting in the halls, cafeteria, or student lounge) interferes with my teaching. d. I receive a great deal of support from parents for the work I do. e. Necessary materials such as textbooks, supplies, and copy machines are available as needed by the staff. f. Routine duties and paperwork interfere with my job of teaching. My principal enforces school rules for student conduct and backs me up when I need it. g. Rules for student behavior are consistently enforced by teachers in this school, even for students who are not in their classes. h. Most of my colleagues share my beliefs and values about what the central mission of the school should be. i. The principal knows what kind of school he or she wants and has communicated it to the staff. j. There is a great deal of cooperative effort among the staff members. k. In this school, staff members are recognized for a job well done. l. I worry about the security of my job because of the performance of my students or my school on state and/or local tests. m. State content standards have had a positive influence on my satisfaction with teaching. n. I am given the support I need to teach students with special needs. o. Strongly disagree Somewhat disagree Somewhat agree Strongly agree The amount of student tardiness and class cutting in this school interferes with my teaching. p. I am generally satisfied with being a teacher at this school. q. I make a conscious effort to coordinate the content of my courses with that of other teachers.

I receive a great deal of support from parents for the work I do. e. Necessary materials such as textbooks, supplies, and copy machines are 1 available as needed by the staff. f. Routine duties and paperwork interfere with my job of teaching. g. My principal or school head enforces school rules for student conduct and backs me up when I need it. h. Rules for student behavior are consistently enforced by teachers in this school, even for 1 students who are not in their classes. i. Most of my colleagues share my beliefs and values about what the central mission of the school should be. j. The principal or school head knows what kind of school he or she wants and has communicated it to the staff. k. There is a great deal of cooperative effort among the staff members. l. In this school, staff members are recognized for a job well done. m. I worry about the security of my job because of the performance of my students or my school on state and/or local tests. n. State or district content standards have had a positive influence on my satisfaction with teaching. o. I am given the support I need to teach students with special needs. p. The amount of student tardiness and class cutting in this school interferes with my 1 teaching. q. I am generally satisfied with being a teacher at this school. r. I make a conscious effort to coordinate the content of my courses with that of other 1 teachers.

CT colonography, sometimes called virtual colonoscopy, is a test that looks for cancer in the colon. Unlike regular colonoscopies, you do not need medication to make you sleepy during the test. In this test, your colon is filled with air and you are moved through a donut-shaped X-ray machine as you lie on your back and then your stomach. Do (you/you or any members of your household) have a Flexible Spending Account for health expenses? These accounts are offered by some employers to allow employees to set aside pre-tax dollars of their own money for their use throughout the year to reimburse themselves for their out-of-pocket expenses for health care. With this type of account, any money remaining in the account at the end of the year, following a short grace period, is lost to the employee.

question_text: There are some ways a parent (who doesn't live with a child) may provide support that are different than a child support payment. This is known as in-kind support. question_text: ^C_DIDWILL ^TEMPNAME claim an Earned Income Tax Credit (EITC) on ^HISHER tax year ^CALENDAR_YEAR-1 federal income tax return? The EITC is a benefit for people who work and have low to moderate wage earnings. The EITC reduces the amount of taxes you may owe and often results in an income benefit to the eligible federal tax filer. This is different from the Expanded Child Tax Credit, which provides a monthly payment to families with children.
survey_key: Survey of Income and Program Participation (SIPP)

Use one or more security cameras to monitor the school k. Provide two-way radios to any staff l. Require metal detector checks on students every day m. question_text: Please select the number of arrests*, including both students and non-students, that occurred at your school* during the 2019–20 school year.
survey_key: School Survey on Crime and Safety (SSOCS)

question_text: To the best of your knowledge, how often do the following types of problems occur at your school*? a. Student racial or ethnic tensions b. Student bullying* c. Student sexual harassment* of other students d. Student harassment* of other students based on sexual orientation* e. Student harassment* of other students based on gender identity* f. Student harassment* of other students based on religion g. Student harassment* of other students based on disability (e.g. physical, mental and learning disabilities) h. Widespread disorder in classroom i. Student verbal abuse of teachers 380 j. Student acts of disrespect for teachers other than verbal abuse k. Gang* activities
survey_key: School Survey on Crime and Safety (SSOCS)

question_text: To the best of your knowledge, thinking about problems that can occur anywhere (both at your school* and away from school), how often does cyberbullying* among students who attend your school occur?
survey_key: School Survey on Crime and Safety (SSOCS)

question_text: During the 2019–20 school year, did your school allow for the use of the following disciplinary actions? If "Yes," were the actions used this school year? a. Removal with no continuing school services for at least the remainder of the school year b. Removal with school-provided tutoring/home instruction for at least the remainder of the school year c. Transfer to an alternative school* for disciplinary reasons d. Transfer to another regular school for disciplinary reasons e. Out-of-school suspension or removal for less than the remainder of the school year i. With no curriculum or services provided ii. With curriculum or services provided f. In-school suspension for less than the remainder of the school year i. With no curriculum or services provided ii. With curriculum or services provided g. Referral to a school counselor h. Assignment to a program (during school hours) designed to reduce disciplinary problems i. Assignment to a program (outside of school hours) designed to reduce disciplinary problems j. Loss of school bus privileges due to misbehavior k. Corporal punishment l. Placement on school probation with consequences if another incident occurs m. Detention and/or Saturday school n. Loss of student privileges o. Requirement of participation in community service
survey_key: School Survey on Crime and Safety (SSOCS)

question_text: During the 2019–20 school year, how many students were involved in committing the following offenses, and how many of the following disciplinary actions were taken in response?
survey_key: School Survey on Crime and Safety (SSOCS)

question_text: Use/possession of a firearm or explosive device* b. Use/possession of a weapon* other than a firearm or explosive device* c. Distribution, possession, or use of illegal drugs d. Distribution, possession, or use of alcohol e. Physical attacks or fights
survey_key: School Survey on Crime and Safety (SSOCS)

question_text: During the 2019–20 school year, how many of the following occurred? a. Students were removed from your school without continuing services for at least the remainder of the school year for disciplinary reasons. (NOTE: This number should be greater than or equal to the sum of entries in item 33, column 2.) b. Students were transferred to alternative schools* for disciplinary reasons. (NOTE: This number should be greater than or equal to the sum of entries in item 33, column 3.)
survey_key: School Survey on Crime and Safety (SSOCS)

question_text: Which of the following best describes your school? 1 Regular public school 2 Charter school 3 Has a magnet program for part of the school 4 Exclusively a magnet school 5 Other
survey_key: School Survey on Crime and Safety (SSOCS)

question_text: Which of the following grades are offered in this school?
survey_key: School Survey on Crime and Safety (SSOCS)

question_text: Please provide the following dates: a. Start date for your 2019–20 school year b. End date for your 2019–20 school year
survey_key: School Survey on Crime and Safety (SSOCS)
